TopicTitle: VAB - Center of Mass not adjusting with fuel level changes?

Articles.Content:
If I remember correctly from KSP 1, when adjusting the amount of fuel in a fuel tank in VAB, the center of mass would adjust as you used the slider to adjust fuel levels in a fuel tank.

This allows you to simulate how center of mass would change as a fuel tank gets drained.

 

Thanks devs, keep up the hard work.

Interesting! Would be good to know if that is also the case in space. Could indicate to numerical solver problems if they do not take the level of fuel into account for center of mass but also for moment of inertia.

It does work in the VAB. It just doesn't update while it's visible (KSP1 did though, would be nice to have it back). Toggle it off and on again and it jumps to the correct new location.
